name: k6-load-testing
description: K6 load testing framework with xk6-dashboard HTML reporting

scripts.demo:smoke:run: TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S) && cross-env DEMO_TYPE=smoke ./k6 run --out dashboard=export=reports/demo-smoke-$TIMESTAMP.html --out json=reports/demo-smoke.json scenarios/demo/demo.scenario.js
scripts.demo:smoke:open: open $(ls -t reports/demo-smoke-summary-*.html | head -1) && open $(ls -t reports/demo-smoke-*.html | grep -v summary | head -1)
scripts.demo:smoke: TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S) && cross-env DEMO_TYPE=smoke ./k6 run --out dashboard=export=reports/demo-smoke-$TIMESTAMP.html --out json=reports/demo-smoke.json scenarios/demo/demo.scenario.js && node scripts/generate-executive-summary.js reports/demo-smoke.json reports/demo-smoke-summary-$TIMESTAMP.html demo-smoke-$TIMESTAMP.html && open reports/demo-smoke-summary-$TIMESTAMP.html && open reports/demo-smoke-$TIMESTAMP.html
scripts.demo:load:run: TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S) && cross-env DEMO_TYPE=load ./k6 run --out dashboard=export=reports/demo-load-$TIMESTAMP.html --out json=reports/demo-load.json scenarios/demo/demo.scenario.js
scripts.demo:load:report: TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S) && node scripts/generate-executive-summary.js reports/demo-load.json reports/demo-load-summary-$TIMESTAMP.html demo-load-$TIMESTAMP.html
scripts.demo:load:open: open $(ls -t reports/demo-load-summary-*.html | head -1) && open $(ls -t reports/demo-load-*.html | grep -v summary | head -1)
scripts.demo:load: TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S) && cross-env DEMO_TYPE=load ./k6 run --out dashboard=export=reports/demo-load-$TIMESTAMP.html --out json=reports/demo-load.json scenarios/demo/demo.scenario.js && node scripts/generate-executive-summary.js reports/demo-load.json reports/demo-load-summary-$TIMESTAMP.html demo-load-$TIMESTAMP.html && open reports/demo-load-summary-$TIMESTAMP.html && open reports/demo-load-$TIMESTAMP.html
scripts.demo:stress:run: TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S) && cross-env DEMO_TYPE=stress ./k6 run --out dashboard=export=reports/demo-stress-$TIMESTAMP.html --out json=reports/demo-stress.json scenarios/demo/demo.scenario.js
scripts.demo:stress:open: open $(ls -t reports/demo-stress-summary-*.html | head -1) && open $(ls -t reports/demo-stress-*.html | grep -v summary | head -1)
scripts.demo:stress: TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S) && cross-env DEMO_TYPE=stress ./k6 run --out dashboard=export=reports/demo-stress-$TIMESTAMP.html --out json=reports/demo-stress.json scenarios/demo/demo.scenario.js && node scripts/generate-executive-summary.js reports/demo-stress.json reports/demo-stress-summary-$TIMESTAMP.html demo-stress-$TIMESTAMP.html && open reports/demo-stress-summary-$TIMESTAMP.html && open reports/demo-stress-$TIMESTAMP.html
scripts.demo:spike:run: TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S) && cross-env DEMO_TYPE=spike ./k6 run --out dashboard=export=reports/demo-spike-$TIMESTAMP.html --out json=reports/demo-spike.json scenarios/demo/demo.scenario.js
scripts.demo:spike:open: open $(ls -t reports/demo-spike-summary-*.html | head -1) && open $(ls -t reports/demo-spike-*.html | grep -v summary | head -1)
scripts.demo:spike: TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S) && cross-env DEMO_TYPE=spike ./k6 run --out dashboard=export=reports/demo-spike-$TIMESTAMP.html --out json=reports/demo-spike.json scenarios/demo/demo.scenario.js && node scripts/generate-executive-summary.js reports/demo-spike.json reports/demo-spike-summary-$TIMESTAMP.html demo-spike-$TIMESTAMP.html && open reports/demo-spike-summary-$TIMESTAMP.html && open reports/demo-spike-$TIMESTAMP.html
scripts.test:local:run: TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S) && cross-env TEST_TYPE=local ./k6 run --out dashboard=export=reports/local-$TIMESTAMP.html --out json=reports/local.json scenarios/browser/page-load.scenario.js

scripts.test:local:open: open $(ls -t reports/local-summary-*.html | head -1) && open $(ls -t reports/local-*.html | grep -v summary | head -1)
scripts.test:local: TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S) && cross-env TEST_TYPE=local ./k6 run --out dashboard=export=reports/local-$TIMESTAMP.html --out json=reports/local.json scenarios/browser/page-load.scenario.js && cross-env ENV=$ENV node scripts/generate-executive-summary.js reports/local.json reports/local-summary-$TIMESTAMP.html local-$TIMESTAMP.html && open reports/local-summary-$TIMESTAMP.html
